text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!

I want to make an update video because I have
so many things going on and I wanted
to keep you guys in the loop!

The first update is a very personal update,
it’s very near and dear to my heart,

and that is…. My parents have moved to California,
and I am so happy!

Not so long ago my sister moved down, and
now my parents are here. And it’s awesome

because we are a super close family, and we
used to have to Skype all the time, and

now they are here, in person, and it is the
coolest thing ever!

Just the other night we went over to their
house for dinner, and we played cards

and it just felt like old times, it was so,
so nice.

And 1 of their lifelong goals was to live
by the beach and now they are right there

on the beach in sunny California, great weather,
and I’m just so happy for them!

And I’m happy their here, and I just wanted
to share that with you guys.

It’s just a very personal thing that I’m
happy that my family is together!

For my second update, me and my sister Mo
were invited to Wilton Headquarters.

For those of you who don’t know, Wilton
is 1 of my favorite baking companies,

I have been using their products since I was
a little kid, and I love them.

I have used their products on so many different
episodes of Nerdy Nummies, so I
felt like a kid in a candy store!

We were greeted with a custom Nerdy Nummies
cake, it had Mo and I up at the top.

And then it was rainbow and had the galaxy
on there for my love of space,

Nerdy Nummies cookies, got the 2 dinos on
there, and it even had little puppy Cookie!
Ohhhhh, do-do-do-do-do! So cute!

We spent a couple days going to their baking
school and cake lab, it was just so fun

to spend time with a group of people, a company,
who nerds out on
baking as much as I do!

Some of the things we did were: We toured
the baking school, we played with

decorating dough for the first time, it’s
very similar to fondant, but it’s a little

bit easier to work with, I actually loved
it. And we made our own little

Cookie dogs! Mine didn’t look so much like
her, but it’s OK!

I even learned the science of how they tested
their frosting bags, I was always

wondering how they tested these, and I actually
got to work the machine that tests

them, so it was pretty cool! I felt like I
was in High School science class again.

We decorated some mustache cookies, we made
fondant cupcake toppers like the periodic

table, we played with candy melts, made some
candy bars, we also made some
succulents out of gum paste.

Gum paste is new to me, I have never worked
with this material before, and now,

I love it! It gave me so many more ideas of
what I can do on Nerdy Nummies!

And, last but not least, we also learned how to
make a cupcake rose, the signature

Wilton rose. I actually asked them how to
do it because my name

means rose, and I’ve been wanting to learn
how to make a rose cupcake for
a really long time, and now I know how!

Now that we are back from the trip, I have
some exciting news! We just partnered

with Wilton to make some baking videos! Some
of those videos will be on my channel,

and some of the videos will be on Wilton’s
channel.

We are gonna make decorating videos, some
how to videos, and instructional videos.

Anything that we thought would be fun or helpful
for you guys. I am so excited!

And as soon as those videos go up, I will
be putting out all the links!
I’m excited!

Next update is that I have had some awesome
guests come bake with me on

Nerdy Nummies, and if you missed those collabs,
I wanted to put a link down below for

you to go check ‘em out! The first guest that
I had was Astrophysicist Neil Degrasse

Tyson! He is my favorite Astrophysicist, and
we made a Star Trek cake together,

and it was amazing! I love Star Trek, he loves
Star Trek and it was like,
so fun! Oh my gosh!

And, he’s actually really good in the kitchen,
he’s a good baker!

And the second guest that I had was Michelle
Phan! She’s so talented and inspiring,
and seriously, like, the sweetest person ever, I love her!

We made Super Smash Bros. Cupcakes, they were
so cute!

She made Peach, I made Kirby, and we made
cupcake magic!

I’ll put a link to both of those collabs
down below, if you haven’t seen ‘em
you can check ‘em out!

Moving on to the 4th update, I’ve been getting
a lot of requests from you guys for

some behind the scenes footage of my first
music video Perfect Together, and, I’ve

got some good news! My friend Greg Aronowitz
who directed and produced the music

video, he just released a behind the scenes
video on his channel, so I’ll put a

link down below if you want to go check that
out.

Also, I have a little bit of behind the scenes
footage. And I’ve been getting a lot

of questions from you guys, like, where did
I film the music video? So I am here
to answer those questions for you!

1 of the most frequently asked questions was,
where did you film Perfect Together?

And the answer is I filmed at the YouTube
Space LA on Stage 1, which is their

largest soundstage. Greg the producer and
director of the video did an amazing

job of transforming the space from a blank
soundstage, into a gorgeous
French Ballroom!

Another frequently asked question was about
me falling down the stairs, and the

answer is, that was not actually me falling
down the stairs, that was a professional

stunt double. This was so cool, because this
was the first project, in my whole

life, where I’ve ever worked with a stunt
double. And Sydney was amazing!

It was so cool, and I learned so much about
how that process works!

Got a lot of questions about where the dance
in Perfect Together came from.

You guys wanted to know, was it an original
dance, or, was it an old traditional

dance? And the answer is Marissa the choreographer
made this custom dance for this

song. It was based off a waltz, and it was
just a very beautiful simple dance.

It was so cool because I got to work with
30 professional dancers, the dancers

brought so much life to the video, because
what’s the point of a ballroom without
ballroom dancers?

You guys also asked where I found the dresses
in the music video Perfect Together,

and the answer is Etsy! My sister and I were
looking online for 17-1800 style

Marie Antoinette-like dresses and we found this
Etsy store, and I fell in love with them!

The dresses were so cute! Fun fact, I bought
the dresses before we had confirmed

that we were actually going to be making and
doing a ballroom music video.

I just fell in love with the idea! So, which
came first, the dresses or the
music video? The dresses did!

Fifth update, in Cookie news, Cookie can actually
go down the stairs now!

Now she can go up and down, and all over!
I really gotta keep my eye on that
little nugget! She’s like… The Juggernaut!

She just, she, you just can’t stop her.
She, just the other day ran through

my screen door! Just knocked it right out!
She didn’t even hesitate!
So, I have to get that replaced!
That girl’s on fire, I can’t stop her!

Lastly, is just a big thank you to everyone
who has made covers of my first song

Perfect Together, they are so cool! I love
hearing them.

And, a big thank you to everyone who has been
requesting my song on the radio,

I actually heard the song twice on the Radio
last week, and it was so surreal!

Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you,
thank you!

And thanks for watching this update video
and behind the scenes!
Alright, bye!
